description.narrative: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages with a commitment to reduce mortality from non-communicable diseases including mental health and well-being. This goal also commits to achieve universal health coverage, for access to safe, effective, quality and affordable essential curative and preventive services for all.

The AcT Phase 2 interventions are proposed to ensure greater inclusion, dignity, access to quality health and care and secure lives through regular and sustainable universal income, and increased protection from wanton killings due to witchcraft accusations.

We will work to promote social protection as universal, rights-based national social protection floors that address a range of life cycle risks as set out in the ILO Recommendation 2025. Building on the momentum created during AcT 1, we will further strengthen older men and women's role in demanding the realisation of the commitment made by the Government to provide universal pension. We will continue engaging with the national social protection working group driving the Social Protection Framework which has identified universal pension as one of the pillars and a priority in the short and medium term implementation plan by the Government.
